HMD Trucking Inc Sponsored Happy Monday Everyone📣 🏡 This truck-based RV is nuts! Back in the early 1970s, motor homes like this ultra-rare Camelot Cruiser were considered extremely luxurious, and most of all supremely comfortable because of their size and layout. Only three of these opulent and luxurious vehicles were built. Its trailer features a luxury kitchen, a large living room, a bedroom with a double bed, a restroom, a sitting room, all fully decorated and furnished. There is even a basement garage containing two vintage snowmobiles. 🚛 The semi, a Ford C750, is powered by 5.8-liter gasoline engine, and equipped with a sleeper on the back of the cab. Yeah, this is the place where chauffeur is supposed to have his break time. 👋 Want to have an exciting OTR career with a great trucking company? Here is our deal: • OTR Dry van – 60 CPM Base + 10 CPM Bonus; • OTR Flatbed – 65 CPM Base + 5 CPM Productivity Bonus + Load pay; • OTR Teams – 77 CPM Base + 5 CPM Safety Bonus + 4 CPM while hauling HazMat/Doubles; • New or well-maintained Peterbilt 567 or 579 assigned to you. 👍 Interested? Finish your app, and we will contact you asap: https://hmdjobs.com/fb #HMDhistory #truckingjobs #truckingcompany #hmdtrucking HMD Trucking Inc Learn more

HMD Trucking Inc Sponsored The sleeper cab is an obligatory compartment for a long-haul truck. Who was the first to offer it? Kenworth claims they offered an extended cab with a bench in 1933. A driver could take a nap there. Such integral sleepers with a shelf to lie down on behind the seat became quite a common thing for OTR trucking. However, there were other ideas. Some companies bolted “sleeper boxes” aka “coffins” to trailers or to the back of the trucks. Freightliner bolted a sleep compartment atop of a cabover. Such an installation is known as ‘Tiltin’ Hilton’ because it shook anyone in the sleeper as the truck went down the road. 👍 Our drivers run only new and well-maintained trucks. We have 2022 Peterbilts 579 in the dry van division and 567 haul loads for our flatbed division (available with auto and manual transmissions). We have only fresh trucks with APU, inverter, and mini-fridge. ❗ We offer steady loads, many miles, high CPM, bonuses, and benefits. Visit our page for job opportunities: https://hmdjobs.com/fb #HMDhistory #truckingjobs #truckingcompany #hmdtrucking HMD Trucking Inc Learn more

HMD Trucking Inc Sponsored 🔌Did you know that by 1900, electric cars were at their heyday, accounting for around a third of all vehicles on the road? Electric commercial vehicles were produced by a dozen of US-based companies. Detroit Electric, Ward Electrics and General Motors were among the largest producers of electric-powered delivery trucks and chassis for them. Drivers enjoyed electric trucks because they started instantly without hand cranking, had no difficult-to-shift transmission, didn’t spew dangerous lead fumes and toxic noise. Yes, they were perfect for city and outskirt deliveries. Long-haul trucking didn’t exist back in the early 1920s. 🤔What do you think, will modern electric trucks supersede diesel-powered units? We take trucking seriously! Our top-performing OTR solo drivers run 13-13.5k miles monthly and get big paychecks! 💰 Join our friendly and caring team: • OTR Dry van – 60 CPM Base + 10 CPM Safety Bonus; • OTR Flatbed – 65 CPM Base + 5 CPM Productivity Bonus + Load pay; 🤝 Check our job offers and chat with a recruiter here: https://hmdjobs.com/fb #HMDhistory #truckingjobs #truckingcompany #hmdtrucking HMD Trucking Inc Learn more
